name: Peninsular Beachfront Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in a one bedroom apartment advertised with a "sea view". Technically you could see some water, but probably not the view we had hoped or paid for. The furniture was a little dated, but comfortable. However.. the glasses and plates were dirty (very) and one glass broken in the cupboard. The shower needed a good scrub and there was mould in large patches on the ceiling. Our window blind also broke - these things happen, and a serviceman turned up to fix up despite me asking not to send someone til the next day as we had a wedding party in our room getting ready. Anyway, the serviceman just missed the wedding party, but not me getting out of the shower. Lucky I heard him, but he didnt realise I was there. I thought he could have offered to come back at a later stage but didnt - and he was sitting on the coffee table whilst repairing the blind which I thought was a little inappropriate. Having said that, we found the place relaxing and quiet, and the location was absolutely fantastic. I would stay here again - but hope that I got a cleaner unit and a bit more of an ocean view
reviews.title: On the whole, a nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at these apartments for the weekend. The views of the 2 and 3bedroom units are really good and better if above about the 4 th floor. We didn't book and so had the option of two units, one was a standard and one an executive and I must say there was very little to choose between them and in fact we chose the cheaper one as we thought it had better furniture and also a flat screen TV which the dearer one didn't. Alos looked a 3 bed unit and that was spacious and nice and did have a larger outdoor area.
reviews.title: Apartments do vary

reviews.text: The balcony of the 2 bedroom unit is quite small but does fit a small table and chairs, the 1 bed units all face the pool and balcony just about accommodates a chair.
reviews.title: Fabulous, great apartment , fantastic location, lots of room

reviews.text: The position is fantastic and you can walk to everywhere, we parked the car and didnt; use it again until we left.
reviews.title: Great apartments

reviews.text: Our Australian friends stay here every year and booked a 2 bedroomed apartment for 10 days for us. We found the reception to be friendly and efficient, our apartment was well presented and comfortable and we had great ocean views. There are many restaurants and shops nearby. I would definitely stay here again if I returned to Mooloolaba.
reviews.title: Great Apartment with lovely ocean view
Best avoided
reviews.text: I’m planning a trip to Mooloolaba in October and I’ve been checking out the websites of the various apartments up there.

We love the Peninsular Beach Front Apartments and have visited with our family 4 times in the last 13 years and infact we wouldn't stay anywhere else! The location is about as good as it gets - a short stroll away from the sea and patrolled swimming area.The Mooloolaba promenade is a credit to the community -a clean,family orientated area with its playground,barbecues,viewing platform,and boarded walk ways- it caters to young,old alike.The apartment (3 bedroom executive) was clean and spacious with fantastic views and excellent facilities -tennis court,swimming pool spa,sauna,barbecues -close to bus stop,supermarket,shops and apartment underground parking available for storage of cars.We love this location and The Peninsular Resort -we will be back!
reviews.title: location,location,location ...

reviews.text: We stayed in a 3 bedroom exec. apartment (3 adults and 2 children) which was modern and clean. However, it didn't have air-conditioning in the bedrooms (fans only). Only the living room had air con - I don't believe that was made clear enough before booking. Maybe an issue in the middle of summer. Our apartment was also next to one being renovated, so it was alittle noisy at times. Hotel in a great location to shops and the beach. The pool was great and the kids pool fantastic and warm. The car park is a bit of a nightmare, with no logical numbering system.. Other than that, it was a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great Location in a family friendly place

reviews.text: We were a family of 7 ranging from kids to grandparents. We chose the Peninsula due to its location to the family pool, beach, restaurants etc... E'mail correspondence was quick offering me good advise in regards to which apartment (sea views essential!) would suit our needs. Unfortunately when I went to book on-line all their 3 bedroom sea view apartments were booked out due to Aussie school holidays, we were offered non sea views or we could up-grade to the Penthouse. We decided to 'splash out' and take the upgrade and paid them the booking deposit the same day, receiving booking confirmation and receipt the next day. I phoned a week out from our arrival and was reassured that our booking was fine. Upon our arrival we were given a key to a Floor 14? apartment, I asked "wouldn't the Penthouse apartment be on Floor 21?" and we were told that "the penthouse was closed for plumbing maintenance". So my e'mails, phone calls, deposit paid in advance, booking confirmation etc all means NOTHING!!! They mentioned the reception staff member should not have taken our booking and ended up leaving their employment a week later due to slack work issues. We were offered a very outdated apartment with no views at all, but chose to leave feeling very disgruntled at the way our family trip started so badly. Fortunately the hotel Oceans down the road were very sympathetic to our plight and were very helpful to make amends. The Peninsular was quick to refund our deposit, but feel they totally misled me intentially. Oh and they neglected to tell me the pool would also be closed for maintenance...
reviews.title: Not what you booked? Sorry, but tough!

reviews.text: We stayed here on a special deal found over the internet for 7 nights in a three bedroom apartment and were lucky enough to be upgraded to an executive. The location was fantastic and the apartment was extremely spacious, well decked out and had a large balcony. We also arranged to spend part of our holiday in Coolum and after spending 7 days at the Peninsular we arrived in Coolum and absolutely hated it so could not wait to get back to the Peninsular. At the Peninsular we were not able to stay in then one apartment as there were no vacancy but we stayed in one three bedroom for two days and then transferred to another for the remaining 6 days. The apartments all differ and each one is decorated according to individual owners tastes but all were comfortable and spacious. One apartment even had a multitute of DVD's and games which kept the kids happy. The pool area was lovely and well kept and sometimes we were the only ones in there which was great. I could see the older ones swimming with their dad from the back of the apartment while the baby slept. All apartments we stayed in had sea views but the ones on the side had the bigger balconies and views. The higher, the better. We loved this place and it was just across the road from the beach and also very close to a lovely playground for the kids. We will definitely come back to Mooloolaba again and when that day comes, we will have no hesitation to stay at the Peninsular again. It is by far the best located hotel in Mooloolaba and we did have a look at some of the others when we came back from Coolum.
reviews.title: Fantastic location and apartments!

reviews.text: Stayed here with husband and four teenagers. Plenty of room in our 3 bedroomed apartment, lovely views and very handy to everything. Couldn't fault the location. Did not have to drive anywhere. However, the bed and pillows were the most uncomfortable I have ever slept on and there was quite a bit of noise through the night from people putting stuff into bins just below our bedroom. The microwave in our apartment was cracked and a few of the cooking utensils could have been a bit cleaner. The staff were also not that friendly. All things considered it was a bit overpriced. Hopefully now it has been refurbished it will be better.
reviews.title: Great location, lovely views and apartments

description: The Peninsular Beachfront Resort is an award winning Mooloolaba accommodation with 65 fully self-contained 1, 2, and 3 bedroom apartments and penthouses all overlooking beautiful Mooloolaba Beach and Bay. These Mooloolaba holiday apartments are large and modern and all have stunning views and in room broadband internet access. The resort features include four onsite restaurants, hairdresser, beautician, jeweller and a range of fantastic boutiques. The Peninsular also has a gas-heated pool, spa, sauna, 3 large covered BBQ areas, gymnasium and full-size floodlit tennis court. Peninsular Beachfront Resort is right in the cosmopolitan heart of Mooloolaba within a short walk to all boutiques, al fresco restaurants, bars, tours and attractions. Just as important, the world famous Mooloolaba Beach is barely 25 paces from the front door.
